description: The program program works great with my old scanner, saving single and multi-page images and documents in JPEG, TIFF and PDF formats. Easy to use. My only beef is that avoiding saving two images of the last page of a multi-page document has escaped me. I have tried all combinations of the Scan, Scan+, Save, and Save+ buttons. My fault, I guess.
summary: Works great with my old scanner

description: Easy to use; supports all sorts of printers and scanners. Been using for about 10 years. Highly recommended

I simply was sick of fiddling around with insane HP-Scanner drivers on Linux!! First tested the freeware version then decided to purchase the "huge" version, because I don't wanted to be restricted to flatbed scanning and wanted to use all features of my all in one HP-Color-Laser M280nw.
summary: It sets a full-stop to all HP-Scanner-Driver Problems under Linux

description:
I was tired spending hours in testing freeware or OEM-workarounds for scanning with Linux (Xubuntu) OS. VueScan does what it promises: Scanning with obviously (can not test thousands of scanners) every scanner. Also elder types.
From my point of view a VueScan license is a better invest than new hardware or hours of experimental trying other solutions..
summary: Most reasonable scanner software for LINUX

description: After getting it running with an elder ProScan 7200 it did a great job. Solely the first installation required some patience in finding out the successful hardware configuration (w.r.t. USB cable and jack)

Great, nifty tool for nearly all scanners, using it within family.

BUT ... without proper encryption it ...

- LEAKS email+serial+customerID in cleartext,
during validation or startup,
is at least required once.
- COLLECTS statistics

Workaround may be to redirect using hosts: 
127.0.0.1 cloudflare-dns.com # test only
127.0.0.1 static.hamrick.com # version check & feedback-link
127.0.0.1 stats.hamrick.com  # telemetrie: startuptime
127.0.0.1 www.hamrick.com   # validation, requires "Validation Success"
summary: great, nifty tool - but always check

description:
Application pointue pour les utilisateurs exigents.
Reglages fins.
